job_title: Lecturer in Ang Mo Kio New Town,
pros: Good location near my house
cons: Slow progression in future I guess

review_title: Toxic work environment, incompetent managers, low salary with no progression
pros: Opportunities to impact lives of youths.
cons: Some colleagues only know how to boast about themselves in front of bosses but can’t really do their job. Some managers are super incompetent, makes mistakes and don’t have the guts to own up their mistakes, and instead keep on accusing staff wrongly. Despite feedback to management about salary being stuck for many years despite rampant inflation, management never do anything about it. Instead, only want staff to do more and more without looking after the basic needs of staff. There are some really competent staffs with 20+ years of working experience only drawing the salary of what a fresh grad gets these days. And these are staff with families to feed - how to survive?! How degrading and humiliating when lecturer who gets 6K/mth gets stuck at that exact same salary for more than 5years!

job_title: Senior Lecturer in Ang Mo Kio New Town,
pros: This job offers lots of security, it's attractive for anyone who needs a stable income and shields away from recession or retrenchment. Reminder: it is not a "retirement" job.
cons: On top of teaching, lecturers will be assigned many other admin duties that take up a lot of their time and left them with little time to prepare notes, mark assignments, and provide feedback to students on their assessments. You will have lots of work goals to fulfill and have to learn to prioritize appropriately to go up the rank and feel guilty towards the students.

pros: Predicable schedule by following acaedmic calendar
cons: Too many middle managers with different agenda and competing priorities.

pros: Nice colleagues that keep you going.
cons: Too many females sitting in the management, micromanaging. No quota for senior lecturer, even if you slog your entire life you won't get promoted. No mistakes can be tolerated by the management. Horrible workplace.

job_title: Admin Staff in Ang Mo Kio New Town,
pros: Good staff benefits and work-life balance.
cons: Top down mgmt. limited career advancement.

review_title: You need to have great love for youths and education
pros: Frontline work, you deal with students from all backgrounds. Youths are generally vibrant and fun, makes u feel younger as well.
cons: Poor management, poor career progression, poor remuneration. Forget about promotion anytime soon.

pros: Good bonuses and work-life balance
cons: - Administratively heavy, very little time is spent on actual meaningful work like teaching the learners. - Appraisal is based on how much your boss likes you. Even if every single review is good, with exceptional student reviews, you will only get a default C unless you're in the good books of the directors.

review_title: Great people working there, too bad the management really sucks
pros: Nice food, nice co-workers, great working with the youth, near to an MRT station
cons: Management paying lip-service to staff mental well-being, frequent and often unnecessary change to admin and paperwork, in some departments, favoritism was rampant, the way lecturers are appraised are just setting most of them up for failure

You will be able to access educator benefits and some exclusive access to free courses conducted for students.
Work-Life balance.
As you conduct more courses, your soft skills such as presentations will probably improve.
cons:
Lack of technical path for growth for IT professionals.
Need to conduct tutorials, labs and lectures as part of your job.
Less opportunities as compared to non-educational sector to go for paid professional courses/certifications.

pros:
Cheap but don't expect anything fantastic canteen food. 

relatively good staff benefits, stable pay, free parking, free sport facilities, can borrow up to 20 books in school library. 

Staff discount at school stores, most importantly pro family.
cons:
Stifling education environment which depend on ur own RO whether u get to do good stuff with the students. So far SIDM is the most vibrant faculty around. 

Top down management, and be prepare for a lot of paperwork (literally paper and BLUE pen, stuck in the 90s) that will pull u away from the core of who u r hire for - to teach. 

The top management do not get to the ground to know what's happening. Everyone work on silo mode. Top Management required improvement 

The capable ones will be arrowed with a lot of work and seen too many passionate ones who get jaded and leave. 

Events are run of the mill, every year on repeat mode. People are doing thing for the sake of doing things. 
Some lecturers are still teaching dated content. 
New principal is in this year, we are looking forward for positive changes.

review_title: SIDM department hanging on, HR department is incompetent, stuck in the 80s, and innovation-less.
pros: The location of NYP was great.  Foreign expatriate package was decent but not extravigant like some people think we get.  Regular pay scale and bonuses, living stipend and option to live on campus apartments was all great.  Younger co-workers (early 30s) and lecturers striving to make departments better struggle to do so but the intent is there.
cons: ISO standards were continually a cross bore over our heads as lecturers.  No sense of innovation school wide, it was the same rehashed graduation show every single time.   Recycling of learning materials was rampant.  Teaching straight out of books that were years old.   Human Resource department operated by robots, which was the final straw when I left.  So many things school wide are done on pen and paper, I felt like I was in the 80s.  Sill on Windows XP Outlook when I left, had a dual booting machine to have current OS, and then Windows XP to deal with school email on outdated Outlook.

pros: I got my diploma there.
cons: Left without graduation ceremony, thanks COVID

pros: goofg working place to be in
cons: bad working place to be in

review_title: Extremely top down approach in management.
pros: Stable income, cheap canteen food and free parking.  Possible to save money if you are working here.
cons: If you are a lecturer, your reviewing officer and students can review you. However you can review no one. Haha. Like a hamburger. Just prepare your ammo if you get grilled during student feedback review.

pros: They do provide an education where students can learn how people develop entertainment such as animation, video games, visual effects or motion graphics which not a lot of institutions or schools do provide education as how SIDM (School of Interactive Digital Media) offers.
cons: Environment is stressful, all the students lack determination - no passion for their course, lazy, often judgmental and competitive rather than friendly and helpful, lessons aren't very helpful since they only provide instructions instead of teaching any fundamentals or design tips which makes developing entertainment pointless. Teachers are not very kind and caring, as a matter of fact, they are pretty much neglectful and unreasonable, often giving the impression that they hate their jobs as teaching.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ang Mo Kio New Town,
pros: Work-life balance, flexibility in time
cons: Lecturers are expected to do so much more than teaching, it's almost only 20% of the time is given to them for concentration in teaching. The other 80% they are expected to do add on as KPIs else there will be no progression. Example are doing projects for other schools for other gov organizations, run events, school promo etc, it will be better if there is a balance and if our worth are not measured by these extras.

pros:
Autonomy to manage teaching loads, community service initiatives, industry collaborations/ projects and also latitude to work on research projects
Good exposure to industry relevant projects
Fulfilling to work together with learners and see their transformation towards become successful industry professionals
Can be very enriching to manage student curriculum with industry projects as most of these projects are usually extremely new to market initiatives or Gen Z specific 
Allows you to spend time creating social impact through volunteer events/ community projects with students
cons:
Too much middle management with a low level of understanding in people, process and the education business, frustrating a lot of on-the-ground initiatives that could benefit learners if they were more agile
Lack of agility in the procurement process compromising the effectiveness of teaching and learning (the money is there but the processes of procurement actually deter lecturers from using the money). Procurement take 2-3 months on average (~6 months if the purchase is big) and is a real downer for lecturers who want to introduce new technology to their learners.
Would be better if school was more proactive in training lecturers to handle student - family related issues like funding/ financial aid for students, handling mental/ emotional wellness of students, training to teach parents about how to partner with the school and child to achieve education goals.

review_title: Top down, old school with obsolete  middle management
pros: Good colleagues, good environment and colleagues who care about students, teaching and who look out and care for one another. Colleagues are innovative and responsive too (though stifled by middle management).
cons: middle and higher management with ancient top-down approaches. The management practices are not from this century and are rather unenlightened. Unfortunately, the political ones are entrenched in the system. This has been going on for a long time now. It certainly doesn't look like it will stop any time soon, sadly.

review_title: Great place to work. Family oriented environment
pros:
- Freedom to choose technical areas that you are interested in
- Nice boss and friendly colleagues
- No pressure 
- Chances to make positive difference to students' life
cons:
- A lot of additional minor administrative works e.g. preparing for open house, chasing after students on due assignments, etc . Can be hard to focus at time.
- Projects are generally not very challenging

pros: Comfortable environment, minimum micro-managing, trusted to do our work
cons: Some people are taking advantage of the trust to slack and still be paid, to the extent that students are taught the wrong things! Some staff make decision without consulting other affected staff. Some bosses go to unethical means to meet their KPIs instead of for the students' benefit.
